medical_history.chief_complaint: Hypopituitarism associated with pituitary stalk interruption syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at birth with jaundice and seizures. At age 5, the patient developed central hypothyroidism. By 35 years old, mild facial abnormalities were noted. MRI findings included absence of the pituitary stalk and a hypoplastic anterior pituitary.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of blindness, bilateral cryptorchidism, seizures, and jaundice at birth; deterioration in hormonal function leading to hormonal deficiencies including growth hormone (GH), thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), and corticotroph deficits.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother had isolated hypothyroidism. The sister had a normal phenotype and her children were asymptomatic. The father was unavailable for examination.
